ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
AASPIRE Participant Type / Version Administered
Notes: 1= Direct Report (DR); 2= Direct Report - Supported (DR-S); 3= Caregiver Report (CR)

ElementDescription: About how long have (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) been working at this job? If (you/they) are employed by more than one company, organization, or agency, then answer the questions for the job where (you/they) work the most hours, or the job that you (think of as your/consider to be their) main employment.
Notes: 1= Less than three months; 2= Between three and six months; 3= Between six months and one year; 4= More than one year but less than ten years; 5= Ten or more years

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I am / Caregiver Report: I think they are) satisfied with how much (I am/they are) paid at (my/their) job.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I am / Caregiver Report: I think they are) satisfied with the benefits (I/they) get at (my/their) job. For example: health insurance, retirement plans, paid time off, vacation time, or sick leave.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: When (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: they) do a good job, (I am/I think they are) satisfied with the recognition (I/they) get.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report: I think) the rules at work make it hard for (Direct Report: me / Caregiver Report: them) to do (my/their) job. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly Agree; 2= Agree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Disagree; 5= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I like / Caregiver Report: I think they like) the people (I/they) work with.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: I think they) sometimes feel (my/their) job is meaningless. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly Agree; 2= Agree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Disagree; 5= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: My / Caregiver Report: I think they feel that their) supervisor (or boss) is unfair to (me/them). (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly Agree; 2= Agree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Disagree; 5= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report: I think they feel that) people at (Direct Report: my / Caregiver Report: their) job do not seem to appreciate (my/their) work). (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly Agree; 2= Agree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Disagree; 5= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I can / Caregiver Report: I think they feel they can) rely on (my/their) coworkers to do their job.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I like / Caregiver Report: I think they like) doing the things (I/they) do for (my/their) job).
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I think my / Caregiver Report: I think they feel that their) supervisor cares about (me and my/them and their) coworkers.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I have / Caregiver Report: I think feel they have) too much to do at (my/their) job. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly Agree; 2= Agree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Disagree; 5= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I enjoy / Caregiver Report: I think they enjoy) working with (my/their) coworkers.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I am / Caregiver Report: I think they are) proud of the job (I/they) do.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I am / Caregiver Report: I think they are) satisfied with (my/their) opportunities for pay increases.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I like / Caregiver Report: I think they like) working for (my/their) supervisor.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I spend / Caregiver Report: I think they spend) too much time at (my/their) job on tasks that (I/they) do not enjoy. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly Agree; 2= Agree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Disagree; 5= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report: I think they feel that) people at (my/their) job argue with each other too much. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly Agree; 2= Agree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Disagree; 5= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I enjoy my / Caregiver Report: I think they enjoy their) job.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: My / Caregiver Report: I think they feel like their) work assignments are not explained well enough. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Strongly Agree; 2= Agree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Disagree; 5= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: When (Direct Report: I do my / Caregiver Report: they do their) job well, (I am/I think they feel like they are) given more responsibility.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: I understand / Caregiver Report: I think they understand) what is expected of (me/them) at (my/their) job.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Job Satisfaction Survey - Overall, in the last six months, did the things this survey asked about...
Notes: 1= Get worse; 2= Stay about the same; 3= Get better

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) Did you get any help while answering the questions in this section of the survey?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I did not get any help
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me use a computer, smartphone, or other device (for example, they clicked on the answers I chose).
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone read the survey to me.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me understand what the questions or answers options meant.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me decide how to answer the questions on the survey.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I got some other type of help to answer the questions.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone answered the questions for me, without my input.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): They told me (in whatever mode they communicate)
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I have observed the action, behavior, or event
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I can interpret their behaviors and/or vocalizations
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Someone else told me
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I have known them for a long time
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I spend a lot of time with them
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): None of the above
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other, specify
(Caregiver Report) On a scale of 0 to 10, how confident are you about your responses?
Notes: 0= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Employment in Organization Satisfaction - Sum
Notes: Higher numbers indicate higher satisfaction. Sum of (jss_satisifiedpay, jss_satisfiedbenefits, jss_satisfiedrecognition, jss_rulesr, jss_coworkers, jss_meaningr, jss_unfairbossr, jss_unappreciatedr, jss_rely_on_coworkers, jss_jobtasks, jss_bosscares, jss_toomuchr, jss_enjoycoworkers, jss_proud, jss_opportunities, jss_likeboss, jss_unenjoyabletasksr, jss_fightr, jss_enjoyjob, jss_explanationr, jss_responsibility, jss_understanding)

ElementDescription: Employment in Organization Satisfaction - Average
Notes: Higher numbers indicate higher satisfaction. Mean of non-missing responses from (jss_satisifiedpay, jss_satisfiedbenefits, jss_satisfiedrecognition, jss_rulesr, jss_coworkers, jss_meaningr, jss_unfairbossr, jss_unappreciatedr, jss_rely_on_coworkers, jss_jobtasks, jss_bosscares, jss_toomuchr, jss_enjoycoworkers, jss_proud, jss_opportunities, jss_likeboss, jss_unenjoyabletasksr, jss_fightr, jss_enjoyjob, jss_explanationr, jss_responsibility, jss_understanding)
